Comment: On Tuesday we will, exhaustedly, reach Day 100 of Donald Trump’s second term as president of the United States of America. In that time, Trump has issued [almost 140 executive orders](https://www.federalregister.gov/presidential-documents/executive-orders/donald-trump/2025), sparking hundreds of [lawsuits in courts across the country](https://www.justsecurity.org/88175/trump-trials-clearinghouse/). Fifty-five of those legal challenges have been filed by Democracy Forward, often in conjunction with other lawyers and groups. On [this week’s Amicus podcast](https://slate.com/podcasts/amicus/2025/04/100-days-of-trump-was-enough-for-the-supreme-court-to-take-a-stand), Dahlia Lithwick spoke to Skye Perryman, president of Democracy Forward, about what we’ve learned in 100 days of lawlessness from Donald Trump and why winning in court signifies wins across the board.  For more: [https://slate.com/news-and-politics/2025/04/trump-news-first-100-days-courts.html](https://slate.com/news-and-politics/2025/04/trump-news-first-100-days-courts.html)
